title: Behavioral Inhibition, Sustained Attention, and Executive Functions
summary: ADHD is a disorder of self-regulation and executive functions (working memory, inhibition, planning). The most effective intervention is to 'externalize' these functionsâ€”putting the structure into the environment rather than relying on the brain.

effectiveness_metrics.description: Externalizing cues (Point-of-Performance) is widely accepted as the primary non-pharmacological management strategy for ADHD.

mechanisms.name: Externalization
mechanisms.description: Offloading mental tasks (remembering time, holding a goal in mind) to physical/digital tools.

mechanisms.name: Point-of-Performance
mechanisms.description: Interventions must happen *at the exact time and place* the behavior is needed, not in advance.

mechanisms.name: Time Blindness Compensation
mechanisms.description: Making time physical and visible (e.g., visual timers) to counter the inability to sense its passing.

actionable_strategies.name: Visual Time Scaffolding
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Convert abstract time (numbers) into concrete visual space (e.g., a shrinking bar, a closing circle) to externalize the sensing of time passing.

actionable_strategies.name: Next-Action Isolation
actionable_strategies.application_in_app: Force the user to define ONLY the very first physical action (e.g., 'Open document') before allowing them to see the full to-do list.
